channel.title: How To Train Your Dragon
channel.description:
Awesome DVD, Personally it's one of my favorites. It's about a boy who's from a viking family, the vikings kill dragons and the boy can't even get close to touching one. But, one day he finds one that he shot randomly, the dragon was in pain and this boy helped him and got the dragon to fly again. Ratings out of 10? [u]Trailer:[/u] www.youtube.com/watch?v=oKiYuIsPxYk
Yes, yes, i know it's an old DVD!

item.title: How To Train Your Dragon
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I saw this on Disney a while back lol. I found it to be amusing but I just had the feeling that I had seen a similar scene somewhere else. Reminding me of this though does give me a great idea for my mini project.

Lil_Smok3r:

Over the hedge ~ FTW

This ^

How To Train Your Dragon was freaking amazing. As for the whole age debate, I’m 18 and my favorite movie/show is Scooby Doo. Get old, but never grow up I suppose.

item.title: How To Train Your Dragon
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Yeah, we have dragons here.

Anyone know of any other good animated movie I can watch? Preferably not incredibly popular in recent years because I’ve probably already watched it.

item.title: How To Train Your Dragon
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Ruby:

In all honesty all that happens in Scotland is complete and utter blackout drunken nights therefore brave is incorrect

At least it was a step in a new direction for Disney, they no longer followed the stereotypical prince and princess love story. A girl with red bushy hair, freckles, unladylike, and aggressive, instead of a blonde, tall, slim and tan girl.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:14, topic:518083”]Moving pictures is for pussies, my friends.

I watched the movie but it wasn’t that great. I’d at least expect even the children to talk in a Scottish accent like Brave[/quote]
The actor probably was unable to produce the accent, as he is american, i believe. Brave has a cast of scottish and english actors, so it was easier for them to do the voice, rather then an american.

item.title: How To Train Your Dragon
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:10, topic:518083”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=636349.msg4290722#msg4290722 date=1367169341]
Half of this community watches Friendship is Magic
[/quote]It’s called My Little Pony. Don’t address it by its subtitle =.= and no, hardly anyone here watches it. I get teased and hated on all the time for it.[/quote]
I’ve never watched it before, so my opinion is pretty pointless, but I really don’t see how you can watch a series such as that and actually get entertained from it when it was designed for young children (mostly girls I’m assuming).

Read full topic

item.title: How To Train Your Dragon
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

You’re never to old to watch a fun movie, don’t be silly.

Personally, i thoroughly enjoy this movie every time i watch it. I would have given a better run down on the film though, because he didn’t shoot it at random and he was seen as a kluts who caused the village many problems. The movie was based off a book, i’m not sure that dolphin movie you were talking about was, but i’m not sure it was a rip off.

I believe that i spotted a few things that could have been done better, i can’t remember what they are now but there were a few things. So i’d give it an 8/10.

Read full topic

Decent movie overall.
